did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.persname: Connecticut. Teenage Alcoholic Use Study Commission

did.unittitle: Teenage Alcoholic Use Study Commission records
did.abstract: The Teenage Alcoholic Use Study Commission was established in 1965 to study the problem of teenage alcoholic use and implement the recommendations of the earlier (1961) Teenage Liquor Law Coordination Commission, including the holding of a state-wide education conference on the subject.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The General Assembly formed the Commission in 1965 (Special Act 257) to study the problem of teenage alcoholic use and implement the recommendations of the earlier (1961) Teenage Liquor Law Coordination Commission, including the holding of a state-wide education conference on the subject. Arthur Lewis was the Commission's chair, and it held the conference in the Capitol on December 6, 1966. After it issued its report, Teenage Drinking in Connecticut, the Commission went out of business in 1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This record group contains minutes of meetings, a transcript of the conference, meeting notices and agendas, background papers, reference files, newspaper clippings, correspondence, and Soundscriber discs.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
RG 005:034, John Dempsey gubernatorial records
Box A-270, folders: Liquor; Liquor Bills; Liquor Law Coordinating Committee
Box A-301, folders: Teenage Drinking [letters] (10 folders; alphabetical); Teenage Drinking; Teenage Drinking - Miscellaneous; Teenage Drinking Problem - Interdepartmental Coordinating Committee; Teenage Drivers; Teenage Liquor law Coordination
G251tL rep, Report of the Teenage Liquor Law Coordination Commission
G256ta tedr, Teenage Drinking in Connecticut : A Report of the Teenage Alcohol Use Study Commission of the General Assembly, State of Connecticut

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Received from Assistant Clerk of House of Representatives, July 1967.

did.unittitle: 1. Minutes, notices of meetings, agenda, preparatory papers, reference files, newspaper clippings, correspondence, contracts for services, background material used by the commission, and Soundscriber discs

note.p: State Library does not have the technology to allow researchers to listen to the discs.

scopecontent.p: Also includes material relating to the earlier Connecticut Teenage Liquor Law Coordination Commission.
